column4: what is the support like on ubuntu 12.04 on z77 chipset? i am getting numerous crash problems including my logitech usb mouse not working and the installer throwing me "Unable to create '/root/cache/dconf'; dconf will not work""
any tips on getting ubuntu working on 12.04 to install
or should i downgrade to a more stabe version
could try using Quantal. The newer kernel and drivers may help
whats that?
the next release of Ubuntu, out soon
so you mean skip 12.04?
why not, as long as it's a clean install you can skip releases :)
i do development, i dont want to jump into a beta release that wont be supported in 2 months?
non LTS is supported for 18 months
has done since Gutsy here.
how does the mouse connect to the system?
usb direct cable
originally was using the logitech USB wireless and it wouldnt even work at all without some weird unplugging replugging
currently using some amazon.com wireD mouse that is "linux compatible"
have you tried a different USB port?
yes
using USB 2.0 port 1 not the 3.0 ports
does the system have a make and model? Does the mouse have a make and model?
worth exploring
yes
do you get a black screen at boot
no. the gui screen pops up and then gets stuck
how do you mean 'doesn't boot'?
